title: Finding a supervisor

headings.text: Who can act as a supervisor
For Bachelor projects and Master theses
If you cannot find a supervisor for your project
Changing supervisor after the project period has started

paragraphs: Once you have decided to do a project and settled on a topic, you need to find a supervisor. This goes for elective projects, the Bachelor project and the Master thesis.
Part time lecturers as supervisors?Part-time lecturers can also supervise on projects, just not the Bachelor project and the Thesis.
Part time lecturers as supervisors?
Part-time lecturers can also supervise on projects, just not the Bachelor project and the Thesis.
From the employee list, the people holding the following positions can be project supervisors:

More than one supervisorYou add each supervisor when you register in “My Study Activities”. If at that point you don’t know who your supervisor is or you forgot to add any, please write to sap@itu.dk with the information. Only the main supervisor will act as the examiner. For questions about this please  sap@itu.dk You can see the employee list for the different sections at ITU here:
More than one supervisor
You add each supervisor when you register in “My Study Activities”. If at that point you don’t know who your supervisor is or you forgot to add any, please write to sap@itu.dk with the information.
Only the main supervisor will act as the examiner.
For questions about this please  sap@itu.dk
Please be aware of the specific rules as described below, when deciding on a supervisor.
All supervisors must be employed full-time as ITU reers. Part-time lecturers employed at ITU and external lecturers cannot supervise on Bachelor projects or Master theses.

For GBI, BDDIT, DIM, KDDIT and GAMES Allocation of supervisors for Bachelor projects/Theses Submitting a listThe process of finding a supervisor involves submitting a list of up to three potential supervisors in a prioritized order. The Head of Programme and the Head of Department will then allocate a supervisor based on your wishes and on the availability of the supervisors in question. Getting your first priority is not a guarantee. Ahead of the allocation process, you will receive an e-mail telling you how to submit your wishes. GAMES only Before submitting the list, you will have a chance to talk to potential supervisors at an event hosted in September (you receive an email about this)For GBI and DIMWhen writing in the Spring semester For the allocation, you must submit keywords and prioritized wishes by October 10, 2025. When writing in the Autumn semester If you write in the Autumn semester, you will have to find a supervisor yourself.For BDDIT and KDDITWhen writing in the Spring semester For the allocation you need to fill out the prioritized list of three potential supervisors by 31 October 2024. When writing in the Autumn semester For the allocation you need to fill out the prioritized list of three potential supervisors by 17 April 2024. See learnIT group.  ribu@itu.dk if you don’t have access. For GAMESWhen writing in the Spring semester For the allocation you need to fill out the prioritized list of three potential supervisors by the end of October. When writing in the Autumn semester You can either find a supervisor yourself or you can join in on the process running for the Spring semester.When is my supervisor allocated?When writing in the Spring semester You will receive information about your allocated supervisor in November. When writing in the Autumn semester You will receive information about your allocated supervisor in June.

The process of finding a supervisor involves submitting a list of up to three potential supervisors in a prioritized order. The Head of Programme and the Head of Department will then allocate a supervisor based on your wishes and on the availability of the supervisors in question. Getting your first priority is not a guarantee.
Ahead of the allocation process, you will receive an e-mail telling you how to submit your wishes.
GAMES only Before submitting the list, you will have a chance to talk to potential supervisors at an event hosted in September (you receive an email about this)

When writing in the Spring semester For the allocation, you must submit keywords and prioritized wishes by October 10, 2025. When writing in the Autumn semester If you write in the Autumn semester, you will have to find a supervisor yourself.
When writing in the Spring semester For the allocation you need to fill out the prioritized list of three potential supervisors by 31 October 2024.

When writing in the Autumn semester For the allocation you need to fill out the prioritized list of three potential supervisors by 17 April 2024. See learnIT group.  ribu@itu.dk if you don’t have access.
When writing in the Spring semester For the allocation you need to fill out the prioritized list of three potential supervisors by the end of October.
When writing in the Autumn semester You can either find a supervisor yourself or you can join in on the process running for the Spring semester.
When is my supervisor allocated?
When writing in the Spring semester You will receive information about your allocated supervisor in November.
When writing in the Autumn semester You will receive information about your allocated supervisor in June.
In special situations where you struggle to find a suitable supervisor from ITU, you need to consult with the Head of Programme about your situation.
Full-time and part-time lecturers employed at ITU can supervise on individual projects without need of approval.

Supervisors who are not employed at ITU If you want an external lecturer as a supervisor for a project, you can apply to have him or her approved by the relevant Head of Programme and the Head of Education, using the application form for an external supervisor.
The deadline for application is Monday in week 4 and 34 for the spring and autumn semesters respectively.

Hours of supervisionBachelor / Final Report: 15 hours Thesis: 30 hours (15 extra hours of supervision are given at both the second and third examination attempt for the thesis) Individual projects: 7,5 ETCS and 15 ECTS: 5 and 10 hours respectively. The number of hours given is per project. They include the supervisor's preparation and meetings with the student(s); including the exam. However, you should always discuss mutual expectations for the supervision sessions with your supervisor.
Bachelor / Final Report: 15 hours
Thesis: 30 hours (15 extra hours of supervision are given at both the second and third examination attempt for the thesis) Individual projects: 7,5 ETCS and 15 ECTS: 5 and 10 hours respectively.

The number of hours given is per project. They include the supervisor's preparation and meetings with the student(s); including the exam. However, you should always discuss mutual expectations for the supervision sessions with your supervisor.

If you need inspiration or you just haven’t been able to find a supervisor you think would make a match, you can try to reach out to your Head of Programme for suggestions. You can also look at the pages about Finding a supervisor in the Study and Career Guidance section for inspiration.
You can change the supervisor for your project after the project period has started. Please see here for details on how to.
This page was last updated June 2023

title: Changing a Registration
paragraphs: Period for changing a registrationWeeks 35 and 36 for the Autumn semester. Weeks 5 and 6 for the Spring semester.When the registration change period starts, the course list in My Study Activities will show courses that are allowed on your programme and that still has available seats.
Period for changing a registration
Weeks 35 and 36 for the Autumn semester.
Weeks 5 and 6 for the Spring semester.
The list is updated in real time, so once a course is full, it will disappear from the list. In the same way it will reappear if there are suddenly available seats again.
During the registration change period you can register and unregister for all your study activities in My Study Activities yourself.

Summer UniversityYou can still register or de-register for Summer University as well. See here for more information. As for other courses your registration is binding after week 6.As a first step you de-register the course or project you want cancelled and then afterwards you register for a new course or project. You cannot exceed the registration limit of 37,5 ECTS. If you just need to register, you just register without making any de-registration.
You can still register or de-register for Summer University as well. See here for more information.
As for other courses your registration is binding after week 6.

Registration rejected - status ”ikke plads” It can happen that your registration ends up being rejected, with the status: “ikke plads”. The reasons are one of two: No more room in your curriculaIt occurs if you do not have room for an extra (similar) study activity in your curricula. What to do The rejected registration will most likely block you from trying to register for the course again. Therefor you need to  SAP and have them correct the registration status, making it possible for you to delete ("throw out") the registration. When you have deleted the registration, you de-register for the course you want to change and register for the course you want instead.No open spots availableThe rejection can also happen if the course does not have any spots available. Even though the list in My Study Activities only shows courses that have spots left, several students can have registered at the same time, which means not everyone will get the spot in the end. What to do The rejected registration will most likely block you from trying to register for the course again, if it should appear on the list again. Therefor you need to  SAP and have them correct the registration status, making it possible for you to delete ("throw out") the registration. Then you are free to register again if a spot opens.
No more room in your curricula

It occurs if you do not have room for an extra (similar) study activity in your curricula. What to do The rejected registration will most likely block you from trying to register for the course again.
Therefor you need to  SAP and have them correct the registration status, making it possible for you to delete ("throw out") the registration.
When you have deleted the registration, you de-register for the course you want to change and register for the course you want instead.
No open spots available
The rejection can also happen if the course does not have any spots available.

Even though the list in My Study Activities only shows courses that have spots left, several students can have registered at the same time, which means not everyone will get the spot in the end. What to do The rejected registration will most likely block you from trying to register for the course again, if it should appear on the list again. Therefor you need to  SAP and have them correct the registration status, making it possible for you to delete ("throw out") the registration.
Then you are free to register again if a spot opens.

When you have managed to register, it can take up to 24 hours before you are given access to your course in LearnIT. You only have access to learnIT with a valid registration, we cannot grant you temporary access during the two weeks

Following the intended study structure The registration requirement was discontinued with effect from 1 September 2024. If you due to special circumstances cannot follow the intended study structure, please follow this link for detailed information about what you need to be aware of.
After the period for changing registrations has ended (see above), your registration is binding. This means that you have to conclude the course or project and sit for the examination.
